titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland, a proclamation. Charles Porter, Tho: Coningesby. Whereas the safe and speedy conveyance of letters and pacquets by post in this their Majesties kingdom of Ireland is of great importance to their Majesties service, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland, a proclamation. Charles Porter, Tho: Coningesby. Whereas the safe and speedy conveyance of letters and pacquets by post in this their Majesties kingdom of Ireland is of great importance to their Majesties service, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Took printer to the King and Queen at thier Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at their Majesties castle of Dublin, the 28th day of February, 1690. and in the third year of their Majesties Reign.".
Date given according to Lady Day dating.
For the protection of the Post.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 201. Letters ny 2) Soldier the.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
